page.title: 17NIMBUS RECORDS _ LASER DISCS
page.content: {Nimbus Records}employ about 65 people. The company (see page 16) produces: 1.{L.P. Records-}one record is produced every 30 seconds and they operate from 0700-1800. This analogue disc technique is being replaced by: 2.{5 inch Laser Discs.}These are made of{poly carbonate}which has minute dots and dashes for the laser to read. It is called a{digital disc} and because it is read by a laser it does not wear out and is very difficult to damage.{Wyastone Leys is the only factory in G.B. and is one of only 3 in Europe.(France,W.Germany) The discs are made in a modern unit which has to be totally free of dust. The air in the factory is 100 times cleaner than in an operating theatre.{ The discs can store pictures and words as well as sound-{Nimbus Records think {it is the technology of the future.
